availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: F. G. Murphy (Nelson County, Kentucky farmer, mill owner, livestock breeder, and horse raceman.)

body.p: Kentucky farmer, mill owner, livestock breeder, and horse raceman. Lived in Nelson County, Kentucky in 1860. Owned twenty-seven enslaved persons in 1860. Member of the Democratic Party. Participant in a Railroad Convention at Glasgow, Kentucky, in relation to the Louisville & Nashville Railroad in 1850. Partner in the firm Murphy, Blincoe, & Lewis, with C. C. Blincoe and William F. Lewis, until it dissolved in 1854. Owned Mill Creek Mills in 1854. Participated in the Woodlawn Races of 1860.

ab.bibl: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nelson County, District No. 1, p. 69; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Nelson County, Greensburg District No. 1, p. 15; "Railroad Convention," Louisville Morning Courier (Louisville, Ky.), June 1, 1850; "Mill Creek Mills," The Lebanon Post (Lebanon, Ky.), August 2, 1854; "Woodlawn Races," Daily Courier (Louisville, Ky.), May 19, 1860.
